Reason: The configuration option 'dynamic_snitch_badness_threshold' is performance-sensitive. This is because the 'dynamicBadnessThreshold' parameter directly affects the behavior of the DynamicEndpointSnitch, which is responsible for dynamically adjusting replica preferences based on performance metrics. The 'dynamicBadnessThreshold' parameter influences the badness score calculation, which in turn impacts the selection of preferred replicas for read operations. This configuration involves performance-related operations that are time-expensive and memory-expensive within the code context, leading to notable performance variations at the system level. The dynamic nature of the snitch and the sensitivity to the badness threshold make this configuration critical for system performance.
